body.name: Cosco Kidsª MightyFitª LX Convertible Car Seat, Broadway
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 22 hrs 36 mins
features: An extra-comfortable ride that lasts for years: Rear-facing 5-40 pounds and Forward-facing 22-65 pounds
Fits 3 across in the back seat of most vehicles
body.description: Get the car seat thats designed with your familys real life in mind. The Cosco Kids MightyFit LX Convertible Car Seat keeps your child safer in the car all the way from 5-65 pounds. Itll keep your baby comfortably rear facing up to 40 pounds, and then transitions to forward-facing mode up to 65 pounds.Not too big and not too small, the MightyFit LX is designed to take up less room. The car seat will fit three across the back seat of most vehicles, which is great for growing families.MightyFit LX keeps kids safer with Side Impact Protection built right in, and a 5-point harness that adjusts easily from the front of the seat. The harness features 5 heights and 3 buckle locations so you can be sure youre giving the best fit to your growing child.The MightyFit LX Convertible Car Seat is mighty comfortable for kids and convenient for parents too. Kids will love the plush padding that gives them an extra comfy ride. You'll love that the fabric is both machine washable and dryer safe, making this seat super easy to clean when messes happen.If your chosen vehicle happens to be an airplane, this convertible car seat has got you covered. Certified for use on aircraft, it gives your child a familiar seat during the flight. Its compact design also makes it easier to manage through airport security checks.The MightyFit LX is proudly made by Cosco Kids in Columbus, Indiana. Made by American families for American families.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us We keep the village in motion with awesome, essential gear for your kiddos designed with simplicity, affordability, and value in mind. CoscoKids is the trusted brand for every family who sees themselves in us.

Cosco Kids MightyFit LX Convertible Car Seat Get the car seat thats designed with your familys real life in mind. The Cosco Kids MightyFit LX Convertible Car Seat keeps your child safer in the car all the way from 5-65 pounds. Itll keep your baby comfortably rear facing up to 40 pounds, and then transitions to forward-facing mode up to 65 pounds.Not too big and not too small, the MightyFit LX is designed to take up less room. The car seat will fit three across the back seat of most vehicles, which is great for growing families. About this item Fits 3 across in the back seat of most vehicles Side Impact Protection 5-point harness with easy up-front adjustment Colors Available : Broadway & Canyon

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is the best car seat I could have got. My daughter absolutely loves it. I no longer hear crying and complaining in the back of my car. It’s well padded, and over all comfortable for my little one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Head rest needs improvement
reviews.reviewText: This car seat is good for grandmas car. My grandson stays with me about twice a month and we were tired of having to move his car seat at a rest stop in bad weather- he lives 2 hours away and my son meets me half way. So I used for first time and headrest just comes right out - will not stay in place. He is 3.5 so not a real big deal but I feel it should have a way to firmly attach. Like any car seat it took a while to install and the instructions were poorly written. It comes with a cup holder on both sides so he can have his drink and snack. Nice basic seat - does not have leveling device and not sure how easy to convert for baby.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My kid loves it
reviews.reviewText: My 6 year old is 45 pounds. I replaced his old secondhand seat with this one and he says it is so much more comfortable. He also loves the cupholder.I found both the installation and strapping in/strapping out to be simple and easy.The seat feels sturdy and it meets the federal safety standards, which is what really matters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This car seat is nice in that it is made for 5 lbs up to toddler size. This is helpful when your children are growing and you don’t have to purchase multiple different car seats.The car seat has a simple design. It is comfortable fabric and padding. The head cushion was a little confusing to get on but just know you only pull the straps through the back fabric of the seat. The straps are not long enough to pull through the back of the car seat slates. The only other thing is that there is a stand in the back that adjusts for different angles. It is not as adjustable as other car seats I have had before. It seems to sit up more vertical than infant car seats. I will use this a little later when my son outgrow a his new born caraway which only is for up to 35 lbs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Awful smell, but great room
reviews.reviewText: This car seat gets the job done, but it smells HORRIBLE. It comes with no protective plastic or anything. Just a cardboard box with the seat inside. It has the worst chemical smell. I’vewashed the cushion 4 times all with vinegar and still smell the chemical smell. Idk what else to do. It stunk our entire house up for a week. It’s also very loose fitting in the car to where I don’t 100% trust it. The back side that sits against the passenger seat head rest seems not so sturdy when latched into the metal latches in the actual seat. It comes with a huge book of directions but they’re very vague.Also the head rest is a waste and doesn’t snap in. It falls out every time we take her out of the car seat. It’s very annoying.I have a 9 month old and she loves all the extra room in it but I’m just not so sure of the safety of it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Costco approved - Safety first!
reviews.reviewText: This review is for the Cosco Kids™ MightyFit™ LX Convertible Car Seat, Canyon.Safety first for my sister's grandson, and that's one reason why she chose this car seat. Costco has a good reputation for the products that bear their name, which helped with the decision process.This car seat was impressive right of the package.Pros: The materials used feel excellent and sturdy. It can be a rear-facing or front-facing car seat. It will take up much less room than the current car seat, which will work nicely when the new baby arrives in May 2024, and two car seats are required.Cons:None at this time - I will update this review if an issue arises.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive, lightweight, good for grandma
reviews.reviewText: There are a few things I really like about this car seat. First, it is pretty basic and inexpensive. As a grandma, I’m not wanting a ton of bells and whistles - just something to go a few miles around town. The seat is good for that. It is also so lightweight that I can easily carry it through my garage and put in into the car with very little effort. And finally, it has a good weight and height range so I can use it for many years, both rear and front facing, with my grands.Now there are some things I don’t love. The instructions are very long, but some key things need a little more description. There’s not much explanation as to how to install the soft headrest. Do the tabs really just tuck into the fabric slots, or am I missing something? Also the recline stand was nearly impossible to close, I thought I was going to break it. It takes some serious force to get it closed — that felt wrong. The latch belts — the way they slide through the back of the seat — i had to kind of guess on that. I wish the instructions were very clear, but they weren’t. And lastly, the fabric is a bit cheap. I can see it getting pilly relatively quickly. For light use, this seat will be fine though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This car seat doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the fancier more expensive ones, but it works! has padding for the younger babies and infants that can be removed. It's easy to install and seems decently comfortable. Lighter than the heavyduty ones, which is a big plus. Goes up to toddler age so should last a while.
